meanings.definition: A unit of pressure equal to one million bars.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the pressure in megabars to determine the depth of the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The geologist converted the pressure from bars to megabars for easier calculations.
meanings.sent3: When the pressure reached one megabar, the submarine started creaking like an old ship.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the water above created a megabar of pressure on the underwater structure.
meanings.sent5: The megabar of pressure crushed the metal can like a giant hand.

meanings.definition: A large, popular bar or nightclub.
meanings.sent1: The megabars in the city center always attracted a lively crowd on weekends.
meanings.sent2: The new megabar in town quickly became the go-to spot for young adults.
meanings.sent3: The megabar was so popular that even the mayor showed up for a drink.
meanings.sent4: The neon lights of the megabar shone like a beacon in the night.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere in the megabar was electric, with music and laughter filling the air.
